This file outlines the differential equations to formalize the phenomenon of NSSI.

```{r}
# -----------------------------------------
# ---- High Arousal Negative Emotions -----
# -----------------------------------------

dA_dt <- function(A,
                  S,
                  k_D,
                  P,
                  r_A,
                  r_AP) {
  S*k_D*A - r_A*A - r_AP*P
}

# HANE (A) increases only if a distressing event (S) occurs, at a rate that depends on person's level of distress intolerance (D). HANE naturally decreases over time at rate r_A.
# S*D*A: stress is more HANE inducing when HANE is already high!
# r_AP how relieving the pain is to HANE

# -----------------------------------------
# -------------- NSSI Urge ----------------
# -----------------------------------------

dU_dt <- function(U,
                  T_U,
                  A,
                  k_SS,
                  r_U) {
 1/(1 + exp(-k_SS*(A - T_U))) - r_U*U
}

# If HANE (A) has passed urge threshold (T_U), urge (U) changes based on level of HANE and sensory seeking. Urge naturally decreases exponentially at rate r_U.

# -----------------------------------------
# --------------- Pain --------------------
# -----------------------------------------

dP_dt <- function(P,
                  k_PS,
                  r_P,
                  NSSI) {
  k_PS*NSSI - r_P*P
}

# Pain increases only if NSSI occurs, at a rate that depends on a person's level of pain sensitivity and the current level of pain. Pain naturally decays at rate r_P.

# -----------------------------------------
# --------------- P(NSSI) -----------------
# -----------------------------------------

dp_NSSI_dt <- function(p_NSSI,
                       U,
                       NSSI,
                       k_I,
                       T_N) {
  (1/(1 + exp(-k_I * (U - T_N)))) - p_NSSI * NSSI # to keep probability non-negative
}

# If urge has passed NSSI threshold (T_N), p_NSSI changes depending on person's impulsivity.  Probability of NSSI decreases naturally depending on whether or not NSSI has occurred.
```
